para.text: In these regulations, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
"Commission" means the State Athletic Commission of Maryland.
Contest.
"Contest" means any boxing, kickboxing, or wrestling:
Competition;
Exhibition;
Match;
Performance; or
Show.
"Contest" includes a mixed martial arts:
Competition;
Match;
Performance; or
Show.
"Contest" does not include a mixed martial arts exhibition.
"Contestant" means a boxer, kickboxer, or mixed martial arts contestant who participates against an opponent in a contest.
"Kickboxing" means a contest or exhibition in which blows are delivered with the hand or leg, including the foot.
Manager.
"Manager" means a person who, under contract, agreement, or other arrangement, undertakes to control or administer, directly or indirectly, a contest-related matter on behalf of a contestant.
"Manager" includes, but is not limited to:
A booking agent; and
An advisor.
"Mixed martial arts" means a competition in which contestants use interdisciplinary forms of fighting, including various forms of martial arts, involving:
Striking with the hands, feet, knees, or elbows; and
Grappling by take-downs, throws, submissions, or choke holds.
"Mixed Martial Arts Exhibition" means a mixed martial arts event in which:
Contact to the body is permitted in only a restrained manner;
Contact to the head is not permitted; and
No contact is permitted that may result, or is intended to result, in physical harm to an opponent.
"Official record" means the cumulative results of those boxing, kickboxing, or mixed martial arts contests, sanctioned by a regulatory agency, in which a contestant has participated.
"Physician" means an individual currently licensed to practice medicine in this State or any state where the individual resides.
"Promoter" means any individual, partnership, corporation, club, association, or other organization that gives, holds, or otherwise conducts a contest within the State.

"Regulatory agency" means a commission, board, or other entity of a state, commonwealth, territory, or country, created by law or executive order, which regulates boxing, kickboxing, wrestling, or mixed martial arts.
"Second" means an individual who assists a boxer, kickboxer, mixed martial arts contestant, or wrestler during a contest.
The Commission shall meet regularly on a date and time as published on the Commission’s website, pursuant to General Provisions Article, §3-302(c), Annotated Code of Maryland.
In an emergency, the Commission may also meet specially at any time upon the request of the Chairman.
The Commission may affiliate with or obtain membership in national or international boxing or wrestling organizations.
The Commission may adopt any of the regulations of the affiliate organizations.
A promoter holding a contest to raise funds for a charitable purpose shall file, before the contest, the following information:
The name of the charity the contest benefits;
The amount or percentage of the gross receipts from the contest to be paid to the charity; and
A certificate of registration from the Secretary of State.
The Commission shall advise the Secretary of State that a charity contest is scheduled and the names of the principal parties.
At its last meeting preceding each fiscal year, the Commission shall elect a member to be chairman.
The term of a chairman shall be 1 year.
A member may serve as chairman for an unlimited number of consecutive terms.
